foot.licenses.title: Licences — dados.gov.pt:
note.html: Positive values are emissions; negative values are removals (sinks).  The total is net: Total = Emissions − Removals.  Unit: kt CO₂e, where kt = 10³ tonnes and CO₂e = CO₂, CH₄, N₂O and fluorinated gases converted by GWP-100.  Values are presented as published by the source.
modal.report.title: Report — GHG emissions (dynamic)
modal.rules.title: Reading rules & formulas
rules.whenpct.body: only if \( |B| \ge 300 \,\text{kt} \), there is no sign change (\( B \cdot C \ge 0 \)) and the jump is not extreme (\( |C/B| \le 3 \)).
rules.semantics.body: We consider it an improvement when the value decreases: for emitters (\( B>0 \), \( C>0 \)), if \( C < B \); for sinks (\( B<0 \), \( C<0 \)), if \( C < B \) (more negative). If zero is crossed (\( B\cdot C < 0 \)) we show Sign change.

report.policy.note: Even though this is a sectoral emissions module, meeting waste targets affects the total (less landfill, more recycling/recovery → lower associated emissions).
